sentences.text:
Inglewood 

California 
 

INTER-DEPARTMENTAL COMMUNICATION 

 
 
 
December 20, 2019 
 
 
TO: 
 
FROM: 
 
SUBJECT:  OFFICER INVOLVED SHOOTING – FINAL REPORT      
 

SERGEANT GEOFFREY P. MEEKS 

CHIEF OF POLICE 

INTERNAL AFFAIRS DIVISION CASE #FD2019-001 
 

 
INTRODUCTION: 
 
The  following  is  a  chronological  narrative  of  events  leading  up  to  and  surrounding  the 
officer involved shooting incident involving on-duty Inglewood Police Officers Jonathan 
Rivers  and  Julian  Baksh  on  Wednesday,  March  27,  2019.

layout_matches.text:
he  following  is  a  chronological  narrative  of  events  leading  up  to  and  surrounding  the 
officer involved shooting incident involving on-duty Inglewood Police Officers Jonathan 
Rivers  and  Julian  Baksh  on  Wednesday,  March  27,  2019.    The  following  summary  is 
predicated  on  information  obtained  through  administrative  and  investigative  interviews 
conducted by the Inglewood Police Department’s Officer Involved Shooting Investigation 
Team and the Inglewood Police Department’s Detective Bureau.  Evidence collected by 
the  Inglewood  Police  Department  Forensics  Division,  and  examined  by  the  Forensics 
Division and the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department Crime Lab, and all materially 
related Inglewood Police Department documents pertaining to this incident were reviewed 
and incorporated in the summary.

SYNOPSIS:   
 
On  the  afternoon  of  Wednesday,  March  27,  2019  at  approximately  1523  hours,  the 
Inglewood  Police  Department  Communications  Division  received  an  emergency 
telephone call from the Church of Scientology (315 S. Market Street).

t  approximately  1528  hours,  Inglewood  dispatcher  #8  (Inglewood  Public  Safety 
Dispatcher  Stacie  Lampkin)  broadcast  to  assigned  units,  a  radio  call  of  a  suspicious

Inglewood police units 4L12B (Officer Rivers) and 4P25 (Officer Baksh) and an additional 
unit to assist, with Officer Rivers acknowledging the radio call, via the radio.  4L11 (Officer

broadcast also informed that the subject arrived in a two door white newer Chrysler and 
had been on scene for approximately five (5) minutes.

fficer Baksh relayed to Sergeant Aguilar and I that he heard Officer Rivers place himself

formulate a plan.  Officer Baksh believes he arrived on scene approximately one (1) to

sentences.text:
Special Enforcement Team (SET) officers Wunderlich and Bobbs (4E5) were immediately 
on scene as Officer Bobbs broadcasted that officers were hit.

layout_matches.text:
pecial Enforcement Team (SET) officers Wunderlich and Bobbs (4E5) were immediately 
on scene as Officer Bobbs broadcasted that officers were hit.  Officer Bobbs broadcasted 
that an officer was hit in the arm and the suspect was down.  Seconds later, Officer Bobbs 
relayed another radio broadcast that a second officer was hit.  Moments after this radio 
broadcast, Sergeant Smith arrived on scene and began to coordinate both a pathway for 
emergency medical first responders to reach the two (2) officers and the subject involved 
in this incident as well as crime scene containment and a corresponding perimeter.

fficer Wunderlich tended to the subject on the ground by first, rolling him over onto his 
side.  He retrieved a stun gun from the subject’s right front pants pocket and unwrapped 
the garb from around his face.  Officer Wunderlich stated that the subject was making 
“weird” noises, but did not speak any actual words to him.  Officer Elias Alvarez assisted 
Officer  Wunderlich  in  rendering  medical  aid  to  the  subject  by  starting  the  process  of 
cutting the clothing off of the subject.  At that moment in time, Los Angeles County Fire 
personnel arrived on scene and took over medical treatment of the subject.

sentences.text:
On Wednesday,  March  27,  2019,  at  approximately  1633  Hours,  the  male  subject  who 
suffered two (2) gunshot wounds to the upper torso, inside the Church of Scientology, 
was  pronounced  deceased  by  the  UCLA  Medical  Center’s  attending  emergency  room 
doctor, Doctor James Jiang.

layout_matches.text:
n Wednesday,  March  27,  2019,  at  approximately  1633  Hours,  the  male  subject  who 
suffered two (2) gunshot wounds to the upper torso, inside the Church of Scientology, 
was  pronounced  deceased  by  the  UCLA  Medical  Center’s  attending  emergency  room 
doctor, Doctor James Jiang.  Inglewood Police Officer’s Martha Lopez and Rueben Alfaro 
responded to UCLA Medical Center and spoke with emergency room medical personnel.  
After speaking with emergency room medical personnel, the two (2) officers contacted

t  approximately  1528  hours,  Inglewood  dispatcher  #8  (Inglewood  Public  Safety 
Dispatcher  Stacie  Lampkin)  broadcast  to  assigned  units,  a  radio  call  of  a  suspicious 
subject to the rear of the Church of Scientology.  This radio call was initially broadcast to 
Inglewood police units 4L12B (Officer Rivers) and 4P25 (Officer Baksh) and an additional 
unit to assist, with Officer Rivers acknowledging the radio call, via the radio.  4L11 (Officer 
Armando Ortiz) acknowledged the radio call as an assisting unit and stated that he was 
in route from Hyde Park Boulevard and La Brea Avenue.  Officer Baksh acknowledged 
the  radio  call  by  showing  himself  in  route  to  this  call,  via  his  vehicle’s  mobile  data 
computer (MDC). The patrol sergeant, 4S20 (Sergeant Freeman Smith) acknowledged 
the radio call as well.  The information broadcast by dispatcher #8 was that a male Asian 
was  a  wearing  a  black  hoodie;  black  pants;  and  carrying  a  sword  on  his  back.    The 
broadcast also informed that the subject arrived in a two door white newer Chrysler and 
had been on scene for approximately five (5) minutes.

Officer Baksh told Sergeant Aguilar and I, that he was not able to focus on his gun sights 
when firing at the subject.

layout_matches.text:
fficer Baksh told Sergeant Aguilar and I, that he was not able to focus on his gun sights 
when firing at the subject.  The subject had fallen on top of him coupled with the urgency 
of the situation, Officer Baksh was only able to fire the gun with one hand, his right, and 
forced to point the gun in the direction of the subject which was to his left.  Officer Baksh 
was cognizant that Officer Rivers was right there and there were possibly employees in 
the vicinity so he utilized fire discipline and attempted to end this encounter with as few 
rounds as possible.

fficer  Baksh  described  this  particular  area  in  which  he,  Officer  Rivers  and  the  male 
subject were located as being south of the lobby area.  There was a ceiling length wall 
separating the little area where the subject was sitting from the lobby area.  That particular 
area appeared to be semi-private with a large walk-thru opening.  Officer Baksh stated 
that there were no employee’s right in that area, however, he believed the male subject 
could easily run through him and Officer Rivers and make his way toward an employee 
or even escape.

sentences.text:
Summarized Statement of Officer Jonathan Rivers: 
 
On  Wednesday,  September  4,  2019,  at  approximately  1225  hours,  Sergeant  Marvin 
Aguilar and I conducted an administrative interview with Officer  Jonathan Rivers within 
the interview room of the Inglewood Police Department’s Internal Affairs Division.

layout_matches.text:
n  Wednesday,  September  4,  2019,  at  approximately  1225  hours,  Sergeant  Marvin 
Aguilar and I conducted an administrative interview with Officer  Jonathan Rivers within 
the interview room of the Inglewood Police Department’s Internal Affairs Division.  Officer 
Rivers  was  present  with  his  legal  counsel,  Mr.  Andrew  Dawson.    Immediately,  Mr. 
Dawson  objected  to  the  merits  of  this  interview  and  the  circumstances  by  which  this 
interview  was  being  conducted.  Mr.  Dawson’s  objections  were  noted  and  Sergeant 
Aguilar proceeded to read Officer Rivers a  Miranda Admonishment from a department 
approved Miranda Admonition form.  Officer Rivers stated that he understood his rights 
and  declined  to  waive  his  rights  in  regard  to  the  Miranda  Admonishment.    Sergeant 
Aguilar  than  read  Officer  Rivers  a  Lybarger  Admonition  from  a  department  approved 
Lybarger Admonition form.  Officer Rivers stated that he understood this admonition by 
answering, “Yes.”

sentences.text:
As Officer Rivers arrived on scene to the Church of Scientology, he parked on Market 
Street just north of the Church.

layout_matches.text:
s Officer Rivers arrived on scene to the Church of Scientology, he parked on Market 
Street just north of the Church.  As Officer Rivers exited his vehicle and made it to the 
west sidewalk of Market Street, he was met by an employee of the Church of Scientology.  
Officer Rivers met this employee just north of the Church, however, due to the front façade 
of the Church being glass, Officer Rivers was able to somewhat see inside of the Church.  
Officer Rivers was told by the employee that he contacted, that there was a subject inside 
of  the  Church  that  was  acting  erratically  and  had  been  armed  with  a  Samurai  sword, 
however, he no longer had the sword as the subject placed it inside of a parked white 
vehicle in front of the church.

t  approximately  1528  hours,  Inglewood  dispatcher  #8  (Inglewood  Public  Safety 
Dispatcher  Stacie  Lampkin)  broadcast  to  assigned  units,  a  radio  call  of  a  suspicious 
subject to the rear of the Church of Scientology.  This radio call was initially broadcast to 
Inglewood police units 4L12B (Officer Rivers) and 4P25 (Officer Baksh) and an additional 
unit to assist, with Officer Rivers acknowledging the radio call, via the radio.  4L11 (Officer 
Armando Ortiz) acknowledged the radio call as an assisting unit and stated that he was 
in route from Hyde Park Boulevard and La Brea Avenue.  Officer Baksh acknowledged 
the  radio  call  by  showing  himself  in  route  to  this  call,  via  his  vehicle’s  mobile  data 
computer (MDC). The patrol sergeant, 4S20 (Sergeant Freeman Smith) acknowledged 
the radio call as well.  The information broadcast by dispatcher #8 was that a male Asian 
was  a  wearing  a  black  hoodie;  black  pants;  and  carrying  a  sword  on  his  back.    The 
broadcast also informed that the subject arrived in a two door white newer Chrysler and 
had been on scene for approximately five (5) minutes.

nable to determine the vicinity of his assisting unit, Officer Rivers attempted to have a 
dialogue with the male subject.  He proceeded to tell the subject that he could gather his 
belongings and leave, however, the subject was mumbling and looking around the room.  
Officer Rivers advised the two (2) employees to step away when almost simultaneously, 
the subject took an unidentified dark color object off of the table and placed it inside of his 
pocket.    Officer  Rivers  relayed  that  he  felt  uncomfortable  at  this  exact  moment  not 
knowing what the subject took off of the table and placed into his pocket.  Officer Rivers 
said that he increased his distance from the subject after he grabbed the item off of the 
desk from an initial point of three (3) to five (5) feet to now seven (7) to ten (10) feet.

his holstered gun.  Officer Rivers recalled the subject grabbing his gun with his left hand 
and  thinking  that  he  had  to  maintain  that  firearm  inside  of  his  holster.  Officer  Rivers 
maintained his initial grip on the subjects left wrist and bicep and yelled out, “He’s going 
for my gun” several times.  Officer Rivers placed his right hand on top of his gun for the 
sole purpose of retaining his gun in his holster.  Both he and the subject were forcefully 
struggling over the gun as the subject was pulling on the gun while it was still holstered.  
As Officer Rivers is yelling for the subject to stop, Officer Rivers sees that the subjects 
right hand is free and is now utilizing both hands to pull on his gun.  While in the fight for 
his  gun,  Officer  Rivers  could  see  that  the  subject  was  looking  at  his  gun  during  this 
struggle.  Officer Rivers placed his left hand against the subject’s throat while trying to 
keep his gun locked into his holster with his right hand.

earing  the  conclusion  of  this  physical  struggle,  Officer  Rivers  stated  that  he  felt  the 
retention lock disengage and the subject had a grip on his gun.  Officer Rivers kept his 
grip on his gun and all three (3) of them fell forward to the ground.  While on the ground, 
Officer Rivers describes him and the subject facing each other, with both of them gripping 
his gun.  Before he could communicate anything to Officer Baksh, Officer Rivers heard 
Officer Baksh yelling, “Gun! Gun! Gun! Gun! Gun!”  Believing that the subject was going 
to kill him, Officer Rivers continued fighting to maintain a grip on his gun.  Moments later, 
Officer Rivers heard one (1) gunshot.  He heard Officer Baksh yell out, “Fuck, I’m hit, I’m 
hit.”    Officer  Rivers  saw  his  gun  fall  to  the  ground  between  the  subject’s  feet  so  he 
instinctively kicked the gun away as the subject continued to fight with the officers on the 
ground.  As officer Rivers attempted to get up to retrieve his gun, he realized that he had 
been shot.

t  approximately  1528  hours,  Inglewood  dispatcher  #8  (Inglewood  Public  Safety

was  a  wearing  a  black  hoodie;  black  pants;  and  carrying  a  sword  on  his  back.    The 
broadcast also informed that the subject arrived in a two door white newer Chrysler and 
had been on scene for approximately five (5) minutes.

been shot.

n Wednesday,  March  27,  2019,  at  approximately  1633  Hours,  the  male  subject  who 
suffered two (2) gunshot wounds to the upper torso, inside the Church of Scientology, 
was  pronounced  deceased  by  the  UCLA  Medical  Center’s  attending  emergency  room 
doctor, Doctor James Jiang.  Inglewood Police Officer’s Martha Lopez and Rueben Alfaro 
responded to UCLA Medical Center and spoke with emergency room medical personnel.  
After speaking with emergency room medical personnel, the two (2) officers contacted 
the  Los  Angeles  County  Coroner’s  Office.    The  Los  Angeles  County  Coroner’s  Office 
accepted  this  case  and  provided  the  officers  with  a  coroner  case  number  that  was 
documented  in  Inglewood  Police  Follow-up  Report  #3  under  Inglewood  Police 
Department General Offense number 2019-20361.

fficer Baksh stated that he approached Officer Rivers to observe what he was currently 
seeing.  Officer Rivers was on one side of the wall, which was serving as cover, and the 
subject was on the other side of that wall.  There was an opening allowing Officers Rivers 
and Baksh to look into the area beyond the wall and have eyes on anyone in that particular 
area.  Officer Rivers shouted commands to the subject to, “stop reaching” or “get your 
hands out of your pocket” while Officer Baksh looked around the wall to observe what 
Officer Rivers was seeing.  Officer Baksh remembers seeing the subject sitting down in 
a chair rocking back and forth with his hands moving into his clothing.  The subject was 
talking real fast to himself and his eyes were real wide.  Officer Baksh believed that the 
subject was either under the influence of some sort or was suffering from a mental health 
issue.

ummarized Statement of Officer Jonathan Rivers:
ummarized Statement of Officer Jonathan Rivers:

n  Wednesday,  September  4,  2019,  at  approximately  1225  hours,  Sergeant  Marvin 
Aguilar and I conducted an administrative interview with Officer  Jonathan Rivers within 
the interview room of the Inglewood Police Department’s Internal Affairs Division.  Officer 
Rivers  was  present  with  his  legal  counsel,  Mr.  Andrew  Dawson.    Immediately,  Mr. 
Dawson  objected  to  the  merits  of  this  interview  and  the  circumstances  by  which  this 
interview  was  being  conducted.  Mr.  Dawson’s  objections  were  noted  and  Sergeant 
Aguilar proceeded to read Officer Rivers a  Miranda Admonishment from a department 
approved Miranda Admonition form.  Officer Rivers stated that he understood his rights 
and  declined  to  waive  his  rights  in  regard  to  the  Miranda  Admonishment.    Sergeant 
Aguilar  than  read  Officer  Rivers  a  Lybarger  Admonition  from  a  department  approved 
Lybarger Admonition form.  Officer Rivers stated that he understood this admonition by 
answering, “Yes.”

s Officer Rivers arrived on scene to the Church of Scientology, he parked on Market 
Street just north of the Church.  As Officer Rivers exited his vehicle and made it to the 
west sidewalk of Market Street, he was met by an employee of the Church of Scientology.  
Officer Rivers met this employee just north of the Church, however, due to the front façade 
of the Church being glass, Officer Rivers was able to somewhat see inside of the Church.  
Officer Rivers was told by the employee that he contacted, that there was a subject inside 
of  the  Church  that  was  acting  erratically  and  had  been  armed  with  a  Samurai  sword, 
however, he no longer had the sword as the subject placed it inside of a parked white 
vehicle in front of the church.

ut of fear of the subject not being searched coupled with the fact that the subject was 
not  being  compliant  with  Officer Rivers or Officer Baksh,  both  officers approached  the 
subject to go hands on and detain him.  Officer Rivers approached the subject on his left

that he was no longer free to leave at which time he noticed the subject became resistive.

seated.

earing  the  conclusion  of  this  physical  struggle,  Officer  Rivers  stated  that  he  felt  the 
retention lock disengage and the subject had a grip on his gun.  Officer Rivers kept his 
grip on his gun and all three (3) of them fell forward to the ground.  While on the ground, 
Officer Rivers describes him and the subject facing each other, with both of them gripping 
his gun.  Before he could communicate anything to Officer Baksh, Officer Rivers heard 
Officer Baksh yelling, “Gun! Gun! Gun! Gun! Gun!”  Believing that the subject was going 
to kill him, Officer Rivers continued fighting to maintain a grip on his gun.  Moments later, 
Officer Rivers heard one (1) gunshot.  He heard Officer Baksh yell out, “Fuck, I’m hit, I’m 
hit.”    Officer  Rivers  saw  his  gun  fall  to  the  ground  between  the  subject’s  feet  so  he 
instinctively kicked the gun away as the subject continued to fight with the officers on the 
ground.  As officer Rivers attempted to get up to retrieve his gun, he realized that he had 
been shot.

Smith  did  not  recall  hearing  radio  traffic  in  which  multiple  transmissions  were  being
broadcasted at the same time causing an officer’s broadcast to not be heard.

was conducted of both Officer Baksh and Offer Rivers’ duty weapons.

n  April  4,  2019,  the  Verdugo  Regional  Crime  Laboratory  received  reference  DNA 
samples  pertaining  to  both  Officer  Rivers  and  Officer  Baksh.    On  April  9,  2019,  the

n June 5, 2019, a Forensic Biology Report was produced which concluded that the DNA 
profile obtained from Officer Rivers’  gun swab is a mixture DNA profile which includes
n June 5, 2019, a Forensic Biology Report was produced which concluded that the DNA
profile obtained from Officer Rivers’  gun swab is a mixture DNA profile which includes

three  (3)  individuals.  Comparisons  of  the  profiles  and  those  conclusions  would  be 
documented  in  a  supplemental  report.    On  June  8,  2019,  a  second  Forensic  Biology 
Report was completed in reference to this case.  This report concluded that Officer Baksh, 
Officer  Rivers  and  the  subject  (Brian  Statler)  were  contributors  to  the  DNA  profile  on 
Officer  Rivers’  gun.    This  report  also  concluded  that  the  probability  of  an  individual 
unrelated to these three (3) being included as possible contributors is 1 in 440 trillion.

SCENE DESCRIPTION:

he Church of Scientology is a two-story building with a basement that is below ground 
level.  The front entrance to the building is located along Market Street and faces east.  
The entire front façade of the Church of Scientology is glass with glass entry/exit doors.  
There is a parking lot belonging to the Church of Scientology just south of the building.  
The parking lot is enclosed by a black wrought iron fence.

evidence  as  well  as  witness  interview  accounts,  this  incident  began  in  the  “Test
Evaluation & Registration” section and spilled out into the “Testing” section.
